head.name: TAN keywords for verbs
head.desc: This file has been created ad hoc to some basic terms for verbs involved in the creation and editing of TAN files.

group-type.name: Verbs that have subjects that are text-bearing objects: persons, agents, scripta, versions, works.
Verbs that have objects that are text-bearing objects: persons, agents, scripta, versions, works.
Verbs that indicate a passage of text in each of the subject and object where there is agreement of 70% or greater.
group-type.desc: If subject and object are in the same language, the quantity is measured by agreement after normalization, ignoring accentuation, capitalization, punctuation, and word spaces. If they are in different languages, the quantity is measured by the number of words in one source that correspond to words in the other.

group-type.name: Verbs that indicate a passage of text in each of the subject and object where there is agreement of 40% to 70%.
Verbs that indicate a passage of text in each of the subject and object where there is agreement of 5% to 40%.
Verbs that establish symmetrical relationships between subject and object. If X [verb] Y then Y [verb] X.
Verbs that establish transitive relationships between subject and object. If X [verb] Y and Y [verb] Z then X [verb] Z.

item.name: is about
discusses
item.desc: The subject is topically relevant to the object.

item.name: paraphrases
item.desc: The subject paraphrases the object. Relationship may be direct or indirect.

item.name: quotes
item.desc: The subject quotes from the object. Relationship may be direct or indirect.

item.name: parallels
item.desc: The subject is textually parallel to the object. The textual relationship may go from roughly similar up through verbatim. Nothing is implied about whether subject quotes from object, vice versa, or both quote from a common source.
